message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE. 

The paper discusses a deep learning approach for semantic matching of questions and answers, which is a common task in natural language processing. The use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and Long Short-Term Memory Models (LSTMs) suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL). Additionally, the incorporation of question term importance learning using question attention network suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The use of attention-based neural matching models and ranking short answer texts suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). Finally, the use of TREC QA data suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE).
